scope.title: Scope name
scope.description: Name of the global scope for this application. Define an organisational tenant.

cluster.title: Cluster name
cluster.description: Name of the cluster running this application. Define a platform tenant.

environment.title: Environement name
environment.description: Name of the environement for this application. Define a stage tenant.

component.title: Component name
component.description: Name of the component consisting of this application. Define a logical tenant.

app.title: Application name
app.description: Name of the application name. Define a functionnal tenant.

version.title: Version name
version.description: Name of the application version. Define this deployment version. Should be incremented each time application configuration is changed to keep track of changes and allow ease rollin of the application (and rollout in case of problem). Default use Chart appVersion.

data.title: Application data
data.description: List of file and content used to configure SXAPI application. Must contain at least one file named sxapi.yml with content structured as described in the sxapi documentation that could be found at https://sxapi-core.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/2.Configure
examples:
sxapi.yml: |- name: default version: '0.3.58' server: port: '8077' endpoints: - path: '/' body: |-

Default

debug.title: Enable debug
debug.description: Enable the debug mode for sxapi application. Is required if you wan't to get debug trace from the application framework. Should be used in conjunction with a log filter. Read the https://sxapi-core.readthedocs.io/en/latest/core/log for more information on how to configure the log environment in your configuration file.

expose.title: Exposing the application
expose.description: Configuration of the application external access. You can use various method such as NodePort (legacy), LoadBalancer (Cloud cluster), ingress (K8s) or route (Openshift).

enabled.title: Enable
enabled.description: Enable the application exposition outside the container. Must be enabled if you want to expose your application.

kind.title: Provider
kind.description: Name of the method used to expose the application to an external access. NodePort and LoadBalancer create a dedicated service while ingress and route create dedicated ressources.

profile.title: Execution profile
profile.description: Define the NPM profile to execute when starting the container. You can see the full list of profile into the package.json file available at https://github.com/startxfr/sxapi-core/blob/master/package.json

replicas.title: Replicas number
replicas.description: Define the number of replicas for this sxapi instance.

service.title: Service
service.description: Define how application is exposed into the cluster namespace.

enabled.title: Enable
enabled.description: Enable the creation of the service for internal application exposure.

version.title: SXAPI Version
version.description: Version of the SXAPI framework used to run this application. Complete list could be found at https://quay.io/repository/startx/sxapi?tab=tags
